newsitem.title: USA: Kaiser Aluminum sets costs cuts in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Kaiser Aluminum sets costs cuts in 1997.

text.p: Kaiser Aluminum Corp said its goal is to achieve significant cost reductions and other profit improvements by the end of 1997, with the full effect planned to be felt in 1998 and beyond.

The company said it disclosed the goal to employees in an internal memo. Kaiser, which is about 62 percent owned by MAXXAM Inc, said Monday it will report a third quater loss of between $0.14 and $0.20 per share compared with a profit of $0.13 per share for the year earlier quarter.
It attributed the anticipated loss to low recent and current prices for alumina and primary aluminum.
